column4: win7 -> win7 on the same network and same machines and even same files always gave me ~950 kbyte/s for las half year
but win7 -> ubuntu looks like if its limiting connection someway
yeah but why then people always say that ms sux, and linux rules
if it cannot even give comparable speed?
really how to increase wifi connection speed
when it comes to 10gb file its huge difference between 950 and 500 kbytes/s
will the thing called madwifi help me?
that question does not make sense
madwifi are drivers for a certain type of card
as someone said it can be any number of things
poor wireless driver implementation(try a newer one), different tcp/ip defaults, different tx/rx settings by the driver or card even
you cant swap out wireless drivers, each one is specific to your card
all you can do is try a newer revision
timeout values i suppose, how are you mounting a share?
i think it uses gvsd daemons to mount the share, alternatively you can try a traditional approach using mount
